resourceProperties.name: contributor
resourceProperties.description: Contributor or contributors to the resource. It is likely that the target resource will be a foaf:Person but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: creator
resourceProperties.description: Creator or creators of the resource. It is likely that the target resource will be a foaf:Person but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: Descriptive text about resource represented as rich text in XHTML content. SHOULD include only content that is valid and suitable inside an XHTML <div> element.

resourceProperties.name: identifier
resourceProperties.description: A unique identifier for a resource. Typically read-only and assigned by the service provider when a resource is created. Not typically intended for end-user display.

resourceProperties.name: relation
resourceProperties.description: Relation which identifies a related resource.

resourceProperties.name: subject
resourceProperties.description: Tag or keyword for a resource. Each occurrence of a dcterms:subject property denotes an additional tag for the resource.

resourceProperties.name: title
resourceProperties.description: Title of the resource represented as rich text in XHTML content. SHOULD include only content that is valid inside an XHTML <span> element.

resourceProperties.name: isVersionOf
resourceProperties.description: The concept resource of which this resource is a version. The subject of this property must be the version resource URI.

resourceProperties.name: member
resourceProperties.description: OSLC domains might define a number of member or contains relationships between resources. The rdfs:member property is suitable for use when only one such relationship needs to be defined, or when no additional semantics need to be implied by the property name

resourceProperties.name: label
resourceProperties.description: May be used to provide a human-readable version of a resource's name.

resourceProperties.name: subClassOf
resourceProperties.description: used to state that all the instances of one class are instances of another
